p: Differences also exist regarding the regional affiliation of a company (Table 6). The relative majority of European firms are ‘all‐round enhancers’ (30.9%), whereas North American firms are mostly ‘emergent innovators’ (33.3%). However, firms from these regions are relatively evenly distributed across the clusters. Thus, their strategies seem to be influenced not solely by their home‐country's institutional environment but rather by other factors, such as the framework conditions of other countries they are operating in (Amran et al., 2016). Companies that are more globalized are exposed to a greater variety of institutional settings and tend to show more ambitious action on climate change to legitimate their business (Bansal, 2005).
